Jawa Barat Bebaskan Denda Pajak Kendaraan Selama Satu Bulan
07 Nov 2019, 02:34 by Ahmad Fikri (Kontributor), Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Bandung — Kepala Dinas Pendapatan Jawa Barat Hening Widiatmoko mengatakan, pemerintah Jawa Barat membebaskan denda pajak kendaraan bermotor (PBK) selama satu bulan mulai 10 November hingga 10 Desember 2019. Denda gratis ini diberikan demi mengejar target pendapatan APBD.
“Pak Gubernur (Ridwan Kamil) setuju, silakan satu bulan. Mudah-mudahan itu terpenuhi. Kalau belum terpaksa minta izin lagi untuk diperpanj ang sampai 30 Desember,” kata dia di Bandung, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Hening mengatakan, program penghapusan pajak kendaraan itu untuk mengejar target capaian pendapatan APBD yang mayoritas berasal dari pajak kendaraan bermotor. Realisasi capaian pendapatan belum mencapai target. “Realisasi pendapatan sampai hari ini 83 persen. Itu ada deviasi, harusnya sudah tercapai 85 persen,” kata dia.
Sebagian besar pendapatan pajak kendaraan bermotor berasal dari BBNKB I atau bea balik nama kendaraan bermotor untuk kendaraan baru. Sementara tren penjualan kendaraan bermotor anjlok sehingga ada risiko target pendapatan yang dipatok dalam APBD tidak terkejar.
“Kami mengadakan FGD dengan Gaikindo dan AISI, mereka menyampaikan (penjualan kendaraan) di Triwulan III baru 730 kendaraan dari target 1,1 juta kendaraan nasional. Sehingga maksimal hanya 1 juta, ada deviasi 100 ribu kendaraan. Kami membayangkan itu akan berimbas ke Jawa Barat, pada pendapatan yang kami kejar,” kata Hening.
Hening mengatakan, program bebas denda pajak kendaraan bermotor menjadi pilihan untuk mengejar capaian target pendapatan dengan alasan, sulit mengejar pendapatan pajak hanya mengandalkan penjualan kendaraan bermotor baru. Tren di akhir tahun, penjualan kendaraan baru turun, sementara saat ini terjadi indikasi pelemahan daya beli.
Program bebas denda pajak kendaraan itu diyakini berpotensi menutup target capaian pendapatan APBD Jawa Barat. “Pendapatan yang harus kami kejar masih kurang beberapa persen. Jalan yang bisa kita lakukan dengan bebas denda. Dan ini khusus untuk PKB (Pajak Kendaraan Bermotor),” kata Hening.
Namun, Hening mengatakan, ceruk wajib pajak yang dibidik adalah pemilik kendaraan yang sudah menunggak pembayaran pajak kendaraan hingga STNK-nya mati karena sudah lewat masa daluwarsa 5 tahun. Pemilik kendaraan diiming-imingi bebas denda pajak, dengan korting pembayaran pajak setahun dan itu pun cukup membayar pokok pajaknya saja. “Misalnya sudah sudah 5-10 tahun gak bayar (pajak kendaraan) itu dapat semacam Amnesti dengan cukup bayar 4 tahun, pokoknya saja, denda tidak usah," kata dia.
Hening mengatakan, pembebasan pajak kendaraan itu bisa dilakukan lewat pembayaran elektronik lewat aplikasi E-Samsat atau Samsat Jebret, kecuali persyaratan cek fisik kendaraan yang tetap harus dilakukan di kantor Samsat induk. Terhitung 10 November 2019 hingga 10 Desember 2019, kolom denda dalam aplikasi pembayaran pajak kendaraan elektronik dihilangkan sementara. “Kalau bayar, pokoknya saja. Dendanya dihilangkan, sistemnya disederhanakan,” kata dia.

West Java Exempts Vehicle Tax Fines for One Month
Nov 7 2019, 02:34 by Ahmad Fikri (Contributor), Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Bandung - Head of the West Java Revenue Service, Hening Widiatmoko, said that the West Java government has waived motor vehicle tax (PBK) penalties for one month from November 10 to December 10, 2019. This free fine is given in pursuit of the APBD revenue target.
"The Governor (Ridwan Kamil) agrees, please take a month. Hopefully that is fulfilled. If you haven't been forced to ask for more permission to be extended until 30 December, "he said in Bandung, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Hening said that the vehicle tax elimination program was to pursue the target of achieving the majority of APBD revenue from motor vehicle tax. Realization of revenue achievements has not reached the target. "Realization of revenue to date is 83 percent. There is a deviation, it should have reached 85 percent, "he said.
Most of the motor vehicle tax revenue comes from BBNKB I or the transfer of motor vehicle transfer fees for new vehicles. While the trend of motor vehicle sales plummeted, there is a risk that the revenue target pegged in the regional budget is not overtaken.
"We held a FGD with Gaikindo and AISI, they conveyed (vehicle sales) in the Third Quarter that there were only 730 vehicles from the target of 1.1 million national vehicles. So that the maximum is only 1 million, there is a deviation of 100 thousand vehicles. We imagine that it will impact West Java, on the revenue we pursue, "Hening said.
Hening said that the motor vehicle tax-exemption program was the choice to pursue the achievement of revenue targets on the grounds that it was difficult to pursue tax revenue only by relying on new motor vehicle sales. The trend at the end of the year, new vehicle sales fell, while currently there is an indication of weakening purchasing power.
The vehicle tax free program is believed to have the potential to cover the West Java regional budget revenue target. "The income we must pursue is still a few percent less. The road that we can do with a fine. And this is specifically for PKB (Motorized Vehicle Tax), "said Silence.
However, Hening said, the taxpayer's niche targeted was the vehicle owner who had been in arrears of vehicle tax payments until his vehicle registration died because it had passed the 5-year expiration period. The owner of the vehicle is lured to be tax-free, with a one-year tax payment discount and that is enough to pay only the tax base. "For example, it has already been 5-10 years that they have not paid (vehicle tax). It can be a kind of Amnesty with enough to pay 4 years, anyway, the fine is not necessary," he said.
Hening said that the vehicle tax exemption could be done through electronic payment via the E-Samsat or Samsat Jebret application, except for the physical check of the vehicle which must still be done at the parent Samsat office. As of 10 November 2019 to 10 December 2019, the fine column in the electronic vehicle tax payment application has been temporarily removed. "If you pay, just anyway. The penalty was eliminated, the system was simplified, "he said.
